body: I don't think it's very common that someone will default construct a `TensorOptions` and then pass it to a function, I think 99.9% of uses cases here are that someone calls `at::zeros({...})` and then the `TensorOptions` argument defaults to the current thread local options at the time of the `zeros` call, like in Python
